settings.subtitle: Your Cooking Headquarters
settings.title: The Biggest Value, The Best Brands
settings.content: We've curated a collection of innovative cookware, bakeware and more, all from trusted brands at the right price.

settings.text: Cook low and slow in an Ayesha’s 6-quart Dutch Oven featured on the Today Show as a “Consumer Reports Best Buy of the Year” and Oprah's “Favorite Things”.

settings.title: Ayesha Curry
settings.text: Look to the Ayesha Curry Kitchenware Collection for an assortment of cookware, ceramics, bakeware, cutlery and tools that reflect Ayesha’s multicultural background and authentic voice and embody her passion for good food and meals that bring family and friends together.

settings.title: Breville
settings.text: Triple-layer aluminum and stainless steel. Tri-ply clad construction combined with a full cap base for even heating and all-range suitability. Breville pots and pans deliver superior cooking performance with consistent thermal stability for perfect results you can taste.

settings.title: Rachael Ray
settings.text: Rachael Ray continues to wow audiences with her special brand of authenticity, relatability, and fun. Bring on the color and convenience with Rachael Ray cookware, ceramics, bakeware, and clever gadgets designed for stylish simplicity and practicality in the kitchen.

settings.title: LocknLock
settings.text: Get organized with no-mess, stay-fresh containers. From essential food storage to pantry organization to meals on-the-go, LocknLock offers a range of essential container shapes and sizes in plastic and glass for airtight, leakproof, portable food storage.

settings.block_text: For over 20 years, PotsandPans.com has been keeping home cooks in the know with the latest cooking innovations and inspirations from the most trusted kitchenware brands.

settings.subtitle: Is your kitchen summer ready?
settings.title: Summer Cooking Essentials
settings.content: From indoor grill pans to beat the heat, to cutting boards that work just as well for serving as they do for prepping, here are the summer cooking essentials every home cook should have in their kitchen.

settings.heading: Our Latest Releases
settings.text: Check back here for the newest offerings in quality cookware, bakeware, food storage, and more.

settings.title: About Us
settings.text:
It’s all in the name. For over 20 years, PotsandPans.com has been keeping home cooks in the know with the latest cooking innovations and inspirations from the most trusted kitchenware brands.

From super-slick nonstick and ultra-durable hard-anodized aluminum, to gleaming stainless steel and the best in kitchen utensils, bakeware, food storage, and more, we’ve curated a wide variety of top-quality products to help every cook create delicious meals to share with family and friends.

Whether you’re looking for value-driven cookware sets, gifts for a special occasion, or a high-performance item for your signature recipe, we welcome you to the home of great cookware, bakeware, and kitchenware. Equip your kitchen with the best from PotsandPans.com.

settings.heading: PERFORMANCE MEETS PRESENTATION
settings.description: Achieve fast, even heat with display-ready ceramic cookware.

settings.heading: CONDUCTS AND SPREADS HEAT EVENLY
settings.description: Hard-anodized aluminum cookware is crafted with thick, forged bases and rims to deliver excellent heat conduction and durability, with a high quality and easy to clean ceramic nonstick interior made without PFAs, BPA, lead, or cadium.*

settings.heading: THE ANTI-RUST DIFFERENCE
settings.description:
Innovative nitro heat technology hardens and seals the surface of the pan, creating lasting
durability and locking out moisture for superior resistance to rust, corrosion, and wear.

settings.heading: What To Expect From Your Pan
settings.description: Your pan will take on a variety of colors and patterns as you cook with it and build up the seasoning. This is normal. Remember to trust the process - the more you use it, the better it will perform. Think of the constantly changing appearance as a badge of honor, and the sign of a well-loved pan.
Stainless steel bases feature a layer of heat-conductive aluminum that spreads heat quickly and evenly to grill, boil, and simmer with ease.

settings.heading: BRING CREATIVITY TO A BOIL
settings.description: Modern, color-finished stovetop kettles deliver quick boils.

settings.heading: BRING CREATIVITY TO A BOIL
settings.description: Create delicious brews and steeps from morning to night with the KitchenAid Stainless Steel Whistling Teakettle.

settings.heading: ADD A POP OF COLOR
settings.description: Rust-resistant porcelain enamel finish inside-and-out

settings.heading: A MODERN TOUCH
settings.description: Featuring a sleek, stylish design, this brushed stainless steel teakettle can be displayed on the stovetop between uses.

settings.description: Match your burner size to your pan size. Don't leave an empty pan on a hot burner or to boil dry.
Heat your pans on medium to low heat. Try a little oil or butter to avoid cooking sprays.
Use potholders when handling hot cookware. Use silicone or wooden utensils.
Cool cookware completely before hand-washing with warm soapy water and a soft sponge
Match pan and burner size and center it. Don't leave an empty pan on a hot burner or allow it to boil dry.
Bring food to room temperature before cooking on a medium to low heat. Try oil or butter to avoid cooking sprays.
Use potholders when handling hot cookware. Use silicone, nylon or wood utensils. Allow foods to release before flipping.
Cool cookware completely before washing. Dry immediately with a towel.

settings.heading: Durable construction
settings.description: Hard-anodized is 8x harder than aluminum for lasting performance

settings.heading: Lock in heat
settings.description: Tempered glass lids* retain heat and flavor

settings.heading: Easy to clean
settings.description: Ceramic nonstick interior provides an alternative to traditional PTFE nonstick

settings.heading: Stove-to-oven meals
settings.description: Cookware is oven safe to 500°F, glass lids to 350°F
Match pan bottom to burner size and center it. Keep an eye on your cookware - don’t leave an   empty pan on a hot burner or allow it to boil dry.
Use pot holders when handling hot cookware. Use silicone or wooden utensils.
Heat your pans on medium to low heat. Try a little oil or butter and avoid cooking sprays.
Cool cookware completely before hand-washing with warm, soapy water and a soft sponge.
Start on medium-low heat to avoid overheating. Carbon steel is extremely responsive to heat.
Building a seasoning: Similar to cast iron, you'll want to season your carbon steel to develop smooth, nonstick-like performance over time.
Remember: your pan isn't nonstick (yet). Until well seasoned, cook with butter or oil to avoid sticking.
Hand wash your pan to preserve the seasoning you've worked so hard to build up. Avoid detergents and scouring pads, stiff brushes, or other abrasives.
Avoid allowing acidic foods to sit in your pan for extended periods of time - this includes tomatoes, lemon, vinegar, or wine, which can strip your hard-earned seasoning.

settings.heading: PREPPING
settings.description:
Fill the kettle no higher than the maximum fill level: below the bottom of the spout.

Ensure the lid is securely sealed on the teakettle – you should hear a loud click. Match the kettle to the correct burner size.

settings.heading: BOILING
settings.description:
Heat the teakettle on medium-to-medium high heat.

Turn the burner off once the teakettle whistles and let rest for one minute. If you notice the kettle does not whistle or sounds quieter than normal, your teakettle may be overfilled, or you may not have the lid on securely.

To avoid damages, don’t leave a teakettle unattended or allow to boil dry.

settings.heading: SERVING
settings.description:
The teakettle can get very hot during boiling – ALWAYS use a potholder when handling.

Avoid touching lid during and immediately after boiling, as steam can escape from the base of the knob where the whistle is located.

settings.heading: CLEANING
settings.description:
This teakettle should be washed by hand.

Empty the teakettle frequently and wash with warm, soapy water, rinse and dry thoroughly. To avoid scratching, do not use harsh abrasives or steel wool.
